Text: The Board of War, also known as the Board of War and Ordnance, was created by the Second Continental Congress as a special standing committee to oversee the American Continental Army's administration and to make recommendations regarding the army to Congress.

<Text: Board of War:  Pressure from Washington and the large volume of military business led Congress to establish the Board of War and Ordnance on June 12, 1776.>

<Text: Board of War:  The Board of War began functioning on June 21, 1776.>
